qas.question: When did Washington University begin desegregation?
What were the first schools to become integrated at Washington University?

answers.text: the School of Medicine and the School of Social Work

qas.question: What student group campaigned for full integration at Washington University in 1949?

answers.text: the Student Committee for the Admission of Negroes (SCAN)

qas.question: What organization sought to strip Washington University of its tax-exempt status in the 1940's?
When did the Board of Trustees pass a resolution to desegregate the Washington University undergraduate division?
In what year was the Student Committee for Admission of Negroes established?
What was one of the last school's at Washington University to be desegregated?
In what year was the School of Social Work established at Washington University?

plausible_answers.text: Student Committee for the Admission of Negroes

qas.question: What is NAACP and acronym of?
In what year was the local Urban League established?

context: The process of desegregation at Washington University began in <a0_0><b7_0><b9_0>1947<b9_0/><b7_0/><a0_0/> with <a1_0>the <b6_0>School of Medicine<b6_0/> and the School of Social Work<a1_0/>. During the mid and late 1940s, the University was the target of critical editorials in the local African American press, letter-writing campaigns by churches and the local Urban League, and legal briefs by <a3_0>the NAACP<a3_0/> intended to strip its tax-exempt status. In spring <b5_0>1949<b5_0/>, a Washington University student group, <a2_0>the <b8_0>Student Committee for the Admission of Negroes<b8_0/> (SCAN)<a2_0/>, began campaigning for full racial integration. In <a4_0>May 1952<a4_0/>, the Board of Trustees passed a resolution desegregating the school's undergraduate divisions.
